HAdVs are non-enveloped, double-stranded DNA viruses, ubiquitous in the environment. adenoviruses (HAdVs) are non-enveloped, double-stranded DNA viruses. dV-55 accounts for more than 40% of identified HAdV positive samples. the serotypes of HAdV may be one of the factors which determine the severity of adenoviral pneumonia. the pathogen has been fully characterized by whole-genome sequencing. current knowledge of HAdV-55-induced severe pneumonia is mainly derived from single case reports or relatively small, single-center series. lower respiratory tract samples, urine, blood, and acute and convalescent serum samples were collected for thorough microbiological tests. patients with HIV infection or neutropenia, those receiving immunosuppressive chemotherapy, pregnant women and malignant neoplasms were excluded. specimens that were positive for HAdV were subjected to a multiplex PCR assay.
